Class ColorPalette

  • java.lang.Object
    • ColorPalette

extends java.lang.Object
    Contains information for color schemes using lists of Colors (palettes)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ColorPalette

        public ColorPalette()
        Create a default ColorPalette, which uses the DEFAULT_PALETTE_FILE_NAME palette of Colors
        See Also:
        getPaletteFromFile(java.lang.String), setup()

      • ColorPalette

        public ColorPalette​(StrColor[][] palette)
        Create a ColorPalette from the given palette. A palette is a list of color schemes, and a color scheme is a list of Colors. Thus, a palette is a 2D list of colors. Color schemes are categories of colors that are grouped together within the palette. Eg. Shades of blue, warm colors, dark colors, etc
        Parameters:
        palette - The custom palette to use
        See Also:
        setup()

      • ColorPalette

        public ColorPalette​(java.lang.String fileName)
        Create a ColorPalette from a text file. A palette is a list of color schemes, and a color scheme is a list of Colors. Thus, a palette is a 2D list of colors. Color schemes are categories of colors that are grouped together within the palette. Eg. Shades of blue, warm colors, dark colors, etc The text file format for creating a palette should look like the following: SchemeName //First line of file Eg. RED_HUES ColorName R G B DARK_RED 139 0 0 ColorName R G B CHERRY 255 87 51 ... ... //Blank line separating schemes SchemeName ORANGE_HUES ColorName R G B GINGER_ORANGE 176 101 0 ColorName R G B HONEY 255 189 49 ... ... etc etc The name of the color palette text file must have the following form: PALETTE_[PALETTE_NAME].txt eg. PALETTE_RAINBOW.txt
        Parameters:
        fileName - The text file that has the color palette information
        See Also:
        getPaletteFromFile(java.lang.String), setup()

    • Method Detail

      • findColorName

        public static java.lang.String findColorName​(java.awt.Color c)
        Find a Color's name using the master list, based on it's RGB values. If the Color is not found in the master list, then an empty String is returned
        Parameters:
        c - The Color whose name is being searched for
        Returns:
        String The name of this Color. An empty String is returned if a name is not found

      • getRandomScheme

        public StrColor[] getRandomScheme()
        Gets a random color scheme from the current pallete The scheme is stored in an array of StrColors
        Returns:
        StrColor[] The color scheme, chosen randomly from the current palette

      • getRandomScheme

        public StrColor[] getRandomScheme​(StrColor[][] palette)
        Gets a random color scheme from the given palette The scheme is stored in an array of StrColors
        Parameters:
        palette - The palette to get a random scheme from
        Returns:
        StrColor[] The color scheme, chosen randomly from the palette

        public StrColor getRandomColor​(StrColor[] scheme)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        StrColor The random StrColor from the given scheme

                               StrColor second)
        Determines if the two StrColors are equal
        Parameters:
        first - The first StrColor
        second - The second StrColor
        Returns:

      • areEqual

        public static boolean areEqual​(StrColor[] first,
                               StrColor[] second)
        Determines if the two StrColor schemes are equal
        Parameters:
        first - The first StrColor scheme, an array of StrColors
        second - The second StrColor scheme, an array of StrColors
        Returns:
        boolean True if the StrColor schemes have the same StrColors, false otherwise

      • areEqual

        public static boolean areEqual​(StrColor[][] first,
                               StrColor[][] second)
        Determine if the two StrColor palettes are equal
        Parameters:
        first - The first StrColor palette
        second - The second StrColor palette
        Returns:
        boolean True if the two palettes have the same StrColor schemes, false otherwise

      • getColor

        public StrColor getColor​(java.lang.String colorName)
        Find the StrColor associated with the color name. If the color is not found, null is returned
        Parameters:
        colorName - The name of the StrColor
        Returns:
        StrColor The StrColor associated with this name, or null if the color is not found

      • getColor

        public StrColor getColor​(StrColor[][] palette,
                         java.lang.String colorName)
        Find the StrColor associated with the color name that is within the palette. If the StrColor is not in the palette, then null is returned
        Parameters:
        palette - The palette of StrColors to search through
        colorName - The name of the StrColor that is being searched for
        Returns:
        StrColor The StrColor that has the given name, or null if it is not found

      • getColor

        public StrColor getColor​(StrColor[] scheme,
                         java.lang.String colorName)
        Find the StrColor associated with the color name that is within the scheme. If the StrColor is not in the scheme, then null is returned
        Parameters:
        scheme - The scheme of StrColors to search through
        colorName - The name of the StrColor that is being searched for
        Returns:
        StrColor The StrColor that has the given name, or null if it is not found

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        StrColor The StrColor associated with the RGB values of Color

      • getColor

        public StrColor getColor​(int r,
                         int g,
                         int b)
        Find the StrColor associated with the RGB values. If the color is not found, then null is returned
        Parameters:
        r - The red component of the Color
        g - The green component of the Color
        b - The blue component of the Color
        Returns:
        StrColor The StrColor associated with the RGB values, or null if not found

      • getColor

        public StrColor getColor​(StrColor[][] palette,
                         int r,
                         int g,
                         int b)
        Find the StrColor in the palette that has the given RGB values. If the color is not found, then null is returned
        Parameters:
        palette - The palette of StrColors being searched
        r - The red component of the Color
        g - The green component of the Color
        b - The blue component of the Color
        Returns:
        StrColor The StrColor that was found in the palette that has the RGB values

        g - The green component of the Color
        b - The blue component of the Color
        Returns:
